column4: Hi how can I connect my xubuntu automatically to internet? is using a wireless card
but when i reboot i need to configure everything again
can you pastebin the contents of your /etc/network/interfaces file?
do alt-f2 and type "gedit /etc/network/interfaces". Also, please put my full IRC nick, cables, in front of messages meant for me. You can use <tab> to autocomplete IRC nicknames.
my mistake. Do alt-f2 and paste in this command: "gksudo gedit /etc/network/interfaces"
and be sure to use http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
i did nothin appears
do you know how to open a terminal?
open a terminal and do "ls /etc/network | grep interfaces". You can paste a command into the terminal using ctrl-shift-v.
you're not putting the command into the alt-f2 window correctly.
do this: "sudo less /etc/network/interfaces"
can you go to the folder /etc/network (put that into alt-f2) then paste that into paste.ubuntu-nl.org
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/7597/
thanks, hold on
thank you
it looks right. I'm not sure why it's not saving your settings.
ok :) well thank you very much :)
no problem. I'm sorry I couldn't figure out the problem.
keep asking here, someone else who's more familiar with this will probably be able to figure out the problem.
are you using Ubuntu or Kubuntu?
there's your answer
that works in Kubuntu.
